more than this number of color targets simultaneously, regardless of
what the GSG says it can do. max-compressed-vertex-data int 0 Specifies the maximum number of bytes of all vertex data that is
allowed to remain compressed in system RAM at one time. If more than
this number of bytes of vertices are created, the least-recently-used
ones will be temporarily flushed to disk until they are needed. Set it
to -1 for no limit. max-disk-vertex-data int -1 Specifies the maximum number of bytes of vertex data that is allowed
to be written to disk. Set it to -1 for no limit. max-dt double -1.0 Sets a limit on the value returned by ClockObject::get_dt(). If this
value is less than zero, no limit is imposed; otherwise, this is the
maximum value that will ever be returned by get_dt(), regardless of how
much time has actually elapsed between frames. See
ClockObject::set_dt(). max-heap-size int64 0 If this is nonzero, it is the maximum number of bytes expected to be
